image_1.description: The image captures a moment at Buckingham Palace during the changing of the guard ceremony, which was scaled back due to extreme heat. A soldier in traditional ceremonial attire is being assisted by a security officer. The soldier is dressed in a bright red uniform with gold buttons and a black bearskin hat, holding a rifle. He appears to be experiencing heat-related distress, as he is receiving assistance from the security officer, who is providing him with water or possibly oxygen. The security officer is wearing a dark vest over a white shirt and has a radio attached to his belt. The background features part of the palace's ornate architecture, including a stone balustrade and a blue door with gold trim. The scene conveys a sense of urgency and care, highlighting the impact of extreme weather conditions on public events and individuals.

image_2.description: The image is a triptych featuring three large-scale sculptures by the influential Pop artist Claes Oldenburg. From left to right: The first sculpture is 'Spoonbridge and Cherry,' depicting a giant spoon with a cherry on top, placed in a serene park setting with greenery and a pond in the background. The second sculpture is 'Shuttlecocks,' showing an oversized shuttlecock standing upright on a grassy lawn in front of a grand neoclassical building. The third sculpture is 'Cupid’s Span,' which consists of a massive bow and arrow, set in a grassy area with a clock tower visible in the distance. Each sculpture transforms ordinary objects into extraordinary and imposing art pieces, creating a whimsical and striking visual impact.
